$interpreted: Sherlock: ...*sigh*...rented a terrible booth location. It's been hours and not a single soul has shown up. How can I do business like this!
Sherlock: Welcome. What would you like...
Sherlock: ...What, you again?
Sherlock: I don't have food for you anymore. So, go away!
Sherlock: So this little orphan is the only "customer" I have for the day...
Sherlock: No good, I have to go to the entrance of the Bazaar to rope some customers. If not, I won't even be able to make rent for the booth.
Sherlock: This is my final warning! I'm going to find some customers right now. You better disappear before I return.
Sherlock: Or I will seriously punch you in the face this time!

Sherlock: Damnit, not a single person wanted to come...
Hmm?
Male Resident: Nice dance! Encore!
Old Man: Haha, what a clever little girl.
Sherlock: Isn't that my booth? What's with the massive crowd?
Sherlock: You're still here? Didn't I tell you...
Female Resident: Little girl, why did you stop? Keep going!
Sherlock: Keep going about what?
Male Resident: Dancing, this little girl just showed us a really good dance!
Sherlock: (Dance? So this crowd is attracted to this little orphan?)
Sherlock: Special event~ Spend a certain amount at Sherlock's booth, and you get to see this little orphan...no...
Sherlock: ...this little beauty's magnificent dance. The event is only for today! Only today!
Old Man: So we need to buy things in order to watch her dance?
Female Resident: Let me see...is there anything I can buy?
Sherlock: 698...699...700! 700 Curren in a single day! My GÃ¶del!
Sherlock: Not too shabby, kid. Look, It was thanks to you that I made so much money!
Bodyguard: Boss, that's the guy.
Evil Merchant: You damn tin can, aren't you arrogant for a newcomer? You get all the customers, what do you think will happen to our businesses?
Sherlock: Aren't you the owner of the booth at the entrance of the Bazaar?
Sherlock: If you can't get any customers despite having the best booth position, either your merchandise sucks, or you suck at doing business!
Evil Merchant: You bastard...wreck him!
Sherlock: Oh, you're staying? Is it your turn to fight me now?
Evil Merchant: D-Damnit! I'll get you next time!
Sherlock: Kid, you've got a name, right?
Lisa: ... L-Lisa Ortiz Aguilar...
Sherlock: Both your parents probably died during the border wars, didn't they?
Sherlock: Now, I will present you a job opportunity. You help me gather customers by dancing. In exchange, I will pay for your living expenses.
Sherlock: You can sleep behind the booth. On top of that, I'll pay you 10 Curren per month. Deal?
Sherlock: No need to think about it. You won't find a deal as good as this in the entire world! Shake my hand and I'll take that as a "yes"!
